titleStmt.title: The traitors claim, or, A clear and impartial consideration of the security as to life, claimed by the condemned traitors now prisoners in the Tower of London, who rendred themselves, according to His Majesties proclamation, of the 8th of June 1660, by advice of the Lords and Commons, then assembled in Parliament in a letter written August 20th 1661, to a Honourable member of the House of Commons now sitting in Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Philoroy, Philopater.

titleStmt.title: The traitors claim, or, A clear and impartial consideration of the security as to life, claimed by the condemned traitors now prisoners in the Tower of London, who rendred themselves, according to His Majesties proclamation, of the 8th of June 1660, by advice of the Lords and Commons, then assembled in Parliament in a letter written August 20th 1661, to a Honourable member of the House of Commons now sitting in Parliament.
titleStmt.author: Philoroy, Philopater.
